page.title: 18FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: The farming in this area is mostly arable,the main crops are wheat,barley and oil-seed rape.These crops need plenty of rain.The farmer at Hadston grows these,and at harvest time he hires a combine harvester. The farm also has 350 cattle,150 are dairy cattle,the other 200 are young cattle,some of which will be killed for meat.Apart from the milking parlour he is not highly mechanised. The farm is made up of old buildings,but recently they have built a new shed for their 150 dairy cattle.They have also built a slurry pit for the waste from the cattle which will be spread over the fields in the autumn to help the grass grow for the hay crop next year.
